column4: i'm not sure, does putting single quotes around the package glob help? or you get the same error specifying the package by it's actual name?
yep same error
that's not a package in the repos right? it was installed with a .deb file?
thats right i downloaded it from Brother
the error message suggests trying to reinstall it and then remove it. either the rm scripts in the package are broken or you manually removed the specified files.
you might also be able to fool with the rm scripts to disable the file checks if necessary in /var/lib/dpkg/info/cupswrappermfc7420*
what should i do then
first i would try reinstalling the .deb and then uninstalling. if that doesn't work then maybe disable or modify the specific file tests in the prerm (or postrm) scripts.
i did what you suggest remove postrm's thanks. you are a lifesave
what did you remove?
http://pastebin.com/fTYhCtNA

that may have been a bit extreme. I'm not sure what those files do to clean up. I was suggesting *modifying* those files to get uninstall to work. It is probably OK, but you need to make sure all the files in cupswrappermfc7420.list are gone.
erase all the files in cupswrappermfc7420.list why??
because since you removed the uninstall scripts, they may not have been removed.
i have my scanner for mfc-7420 works on debian squeeze i added what i added on debian squeeze udev-* file on ubuntu but now response
anyways i gotta go thanks again i appreciate it
the error message isn't really informative, but does suggest looking at make.log in /var/lib/dkms/oss4/4.2-build2002/build/
